etymology.description: semantic 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + phonetic 公(公) (gōng, "public") = shelter something under a roof -> contain
etymology.interpretation: The character 容(róng, "contain") combines a roof radical with a common phonetic element suggesting the idea of holding or containing within a protected space, which makes intuitive sense as a metaphor for containing things under a roof.

examples.chinese: 这个碗能容下满满的饭菜(這個碗能容下滿滿的飯菜)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge wǎn néng róng xià mǎn mǎn de fàn cài.
examples.english: This bowl can contain a generous serving of food.

examples.chinese: 她的心胸宽广(她的心胸寬廣)，能容百川(能容百川)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xīn xiōng kuān guǎng, néng róng bǎi chuān.
examples.english: Her broad heart is capable of containing all kinds of ideas.

examples.chinese: 小房间里容纳不了这么多家具(小房間裡容納不了這麼多家具)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo fáng jiān lǐ róng nà bù liǎo zhè me duō jiā jù.
examples.english: The small room cannot contain so much furniture.
